column4: is there a way to use nautilus to browse a network share (sftp or smb) without actually mounting the share?
the fusesmb tool at one time sort of 'browsed'  the network shares  without mounting them (it sort of special mounted them)  Theres also the cli tools
ok, thx... will there still be a desktop icon for them?
No.
ok, great :)
things get mounted to dirctories in the system tree.. you said you dident want to 'mount' things...
so what exactly are you trying to do?
I have a lot of network shares, that I use very often
I have hotkeys for them too
but I don't want icons for them on my desktop
and I haven't really figured out the best way to avoid that
theres settings to tell GNOME to not show  mounted devices on the desktop.
thats the 'best way' :)
but I would still like it to show mounted usb
i use the 'ubuntu tweak' to tweak that stuff..
you could alwyas just have a icon pointing to the /media/ directory
hmm... I guess I could - but still: it is nice for an icon to just pop up every time I plug in a device
i hate that feature. :) i perfer it to not pop up some lame dialog :)
just because it dont show the icon..it may still show that popup.
well... I hate the popup too, but I love the icon :P
but thanks for the advice :)
the popup can actually be disabled with gconf too :)
thats what ubuntu tweak does.. its a nicer front end then that.
